body:
Question: Would you be ok with a 5v5 TDM tournament?
  • A) Yes (list reasoning) (4)
  • B) No (list reasoning) (6)
  • C) Depends (list reasoning) (1)
My reasoning for having it as a 5v5 is because if it were to be a regular sized tournament, there would probably be only 6 teams (from Avicus) who would be able to meet the registration requirements. If it were a 5v5, this would give smaller teams the opportunity to play, make it easier for people to create teams, and the big teams can split into multiple teams. Would you rather have a small tournament with lots of teams or a big tournament with a lower amount of teams? We will have the maps edited to suit a 5v5 so after all of this, if you still disagree with the decision, leave your vote and a detailed response as to why. Please keep in mind that we will still have 8v8 for the next tournament. This tournament is to mainly be used as an extra tournament and an incentive for smaller teams to develop while still giving everyone a competitive environment. 

When voting, please include the letter of your choice in your response. Submit your vote through a forum response.

replies.body:
Yes.
As you stated, only a few select Avicus teams can actually meet the requirements of 8v8.
What would be best to include as much of the community would be to have it 5v5 atm. 
As you said, it would allow smaller teams to participate as well as split bigger teams up, thus creating more teams & a broader range of selections for newcomers to the community.
Having it an 8v8 will only restrict the amount of players from the community that we include and only condense the amount of teams and diversity of play styles in the community.

Because lets be honest, these new teams won't allow just anybody to join their team, and nor will they actually play every person they have on their team.
If you want to only please a select few, then 8v8 is the way to go, but to actually please the whole community and get them involved, a 5v5 would be 100% the better choice.

replies.body:
A

This is an extra tournament as you called it, and 5v5 makes room for more teams, and it'll allow newer teams to form up more easily.
replies.body_tagged:
A

This is an extra tournament as you called it, and 5v5 makes room for more teams, and it'll allow newer teams to form up more easily.

replies.body:
B

More teams won’t necessarily result into a better tournament, and the chances of a team no-showing are just as likely in 5v5’s as they are in 8v8’s since the team roster sizes would shrink as well.

Stick to 7v7/8v8 and instead make a mini tournament that would have 5v5 roster sizes.

replies.body:
A) Yes

-Try out 5v5 for next tourney and see how it goes, can always be changed in the future

-The more teams we have the more fun it will be, 5v5 enables us to actually get a decent amount of teams entered

-5v5 means there are less dominant teams, the games will be closer and more intense. In previous tourneys some teams had no chance of beating other teams because there were too many better players on the other team, if there are only 5 players a team it gives less known players a chance to do well.
